But hey - anything is better than Vulkan I guess(1-2k lines to render a colorless triangle :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:).

text: how much of a pain is bitmap rendering in vulkan?

elements.text: how much of a pain is bitmap rendering in vulkan?

text:
Although I haven't got that far yet, IMO if you work from the base API without abstractions that can range from insanely painful (with little availability and knowledge of graphics programming) to kind of OK if you know what you're doing (it's probably longer to do than OpenGL, but the resulting code might be maybe easier to use?).
What could work great though is to already have abstractions so that the higher-level bits are there, without having to worry about OpenGL state and all that. But nothing has been really written in Julia yet.

text: Yes for sure! It has to be learnt though, and I can empathize considering that I've gone through some pain myself after having decided to learn how to do graphics with Vulkan with no prior experience.
